item.title: To require the Secretary of State to submit a report on water sharing with Mexico.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Western Hemisphere.

item.title: Working to Address Treaty Enforcement Rapidly for Texas Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Western Hemisphere.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4060)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4059-4060)

summary.text: Working to Address Treaty Enforcement Rapidly for Texas Act - Directs the Secretary of State to: (1) report quarterly to Congress describing efforts by Mexico to meet the treaty obligations of Mexico to deliver water to the Rio Grande, in accordance with the 1944 treaty between the United States and Mexico entitled "Utilization of Waters of the Colorado and Tijuana Rivers and of the Rio Grande"; and (2) report annually to Congress describing the benefits to the United States of the 2012 document entitled "Interim International Cooperative Measures in the Colorado River Basin through 2017 and Extension of Minute 318 Cooperative Measures to Address the Continued Effects of the April 2010 Earthquake in the Mexicali Valley, Baja California."

bill.title: Working to Address Treaty Enforcement Rapidly for Texas Act

item.title: Working to Address Treaty Enforcement Rapidly for Texas Act
A bill to require the Secretary of State to submit to Congress reports on water sharing with Mexico.
Working to Address Treaty Enforcement Rapidly for Texas Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4060)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
